attributes.action: Remove Ntokozo Qwabe, the Oxford student.
attributes.background: Remove Ntokozo Qwabe, the Oxford student who was responsible for trying to remove Cecil Rhodes statue, from the UK. Remove his visa and return him for being a racist boasting about how he mistreated a white waitress and refused to tip because she was white.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.groundup.org.za/article/rhodes-must-fall-leader-waiter-we-will-give-tip-when-return-land/

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3566362/Oxford-student-Rhodes-Fall-campaign-boasts-refused-tip-waitress-white-left-floods-tears.html#comments

attributes.action: Ban Marine Le Pen from entering the UK
attributes.background: Marine Le Pen is planning to visit the UK in May or June. We do not want her fascist and divisive views here. She has to be barred from entering the UK. Please sign this petition to tell the Home Secretary Theresa May we do not want Marine Le Pen in the UK

attributes.action: Allow shotgun certificate holders of ages 15+ to purchase their own firearms.
attributes.background: The law currently states that a shotgun certificate holder can own and possess, a shotgun and ammunition from the age of 15.
attributes.additional_details: Counter productive to this, it is required that a certifcate holder over the age of 18 to purchase the items for them, this can be a problem for potential young shooters who would like to get involved in the shooting sports but doesn't know anyone over the age of 18 who possess a valid shotgun certificate. I am proposing the lowering of the law to purchase a shotgun and ammunition to 15 which is the legal age for possession, when accompanied by their parent/guardian who signed their certificate.

attributes.action:
Replace London Prisons Before 
Their Closure Date, 
We Need Prisons In London.
attributes.background:
Many inmates do not get regular visits from family or friends,
as people can not afford to travel across the country to
see loved ones who are serving a sentence.
To take away a prisoners liberty is punishment enough,
without depriving them of regular contact with family.

attributes.action: A person be given the opportunity to retire earlier on a reduced state pension.
attributes.background: The change in pension age unfairly affects people in the position of caring for somebody who because that person goes into residential care or passes away, places them with zero income after carers allowance is removed only to find it difficult to obtain employment due to their age.

attributes.action: Stop the Government's proposed changes to the Skipton Fund
attributes.background: Prior to July 1992, many people were infected with Hepatitis C due to NHS treatment with infected blood, or before 1987 for blood clotting disorders. Many died and many more are suffering with the pain and misery of this disease, unable to work, adding financial difficulties to their stress.
attributes.additional_details:
The Skipton Fund was set up to provide ex gratia payments to affected patients.

The Government is now consulting on plans to cut these payments.

We must not let this happen; they deserve all the support they are entitled to.

Please sign this petition and pass it on to as many people as possible.

attributes.action: Compulsory prison terms for all drivers speeding to evade a police pursuit
attributes.background: I am horrified by the number of drivers that speed recklessly, particularly through residential areas, threatening the lives of pedestrians and other road users, in order to evade pursuing police. When eventually caught, they rarely receive a custodial sentence, despite posing such a danger to life.

attributes.action: Make the public aware of the dangers of Ibuprofen in children with Chickenpox
attributes.background: A UK newspaper reported a case of parents being advised to taken a brand of medication containing Ibuprofen for chickenpox, causing severe complications (septicemia) Patient UK,NHS Choices,NICE warns of a potential reaction during chickenpox,public need to be aware & medications need to highlight it
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.express.co.uk/news/uk/659299/Nurofen-chickenpox-ibuprofen-septicaemia-parents-danger-medicine-skin-rash

http://www.nhs.uk/Conditions/Chickenpox/Pages/Treatment.aspx

http://cks.nice.org.uk/chickenpox#!prescribinginfosub:1

http://patient.info/health/chickenpox-in-children-under-12

attributes.action: UK should double its Gold because other central banks are buying up all the gold
attributes.background: Gold is money and has been for thousands of years. The money we use today is the faith backed fiat system.People have started to loose faith in the dollar and all other fiat currencies like the Euro.The only way forward is a gold backed currency.
attributes.additional_details:
Interesting websites regarding gold as money

HTTPS://www.hiddensecretsofmoney.com
Http://kingworldnews.com
Http://www.dailyreckoning.co.uk

attributes.action: Offer the Tata steel business to the steel unions and workers.
attributes.background: instead of nationalising tata steel, get the steel unions and workers to buy it as a real cooperative and do not saddle the taxpayer with more white elephants. If they think it is a going concern then they can put their own money up for once.

attributes.action: UK Government to allow people to only claim asylum from UK Embassy's
attributes.background: I want this to be debated in parliament because i believe this will save people using dangerous methods in trying to reach the UK mainland from places like Calais and also putting the lives of truck drivers at risk. It will also reduce funding for the criminal gangs taking advantage of their plight.

attributes.action: Change the process through which referendums are held
attributes.background: The entire electorate to be given an automatic vote in favour of the status quo. Only those wishing to change the status quo should be required to register an alternative vote.
attributes.additional_details: In this way if 51% + of the electorate is motivated to get out and vote a clear mandate for change is demonstrated. Anything else is undemocratic and simply counts those motivated to actively vote, even when they didn't ask for any change to begin with. Only those opposed to majority rule would be against this.

attributes.action: Prevent a policy allowing "reasonable force" to maintain behaviour in schools.
attributes.background: The Department for Education published a policy paper on 17th March, called Educational Excellence Everywhere, this includes a section allowing teachers in academies to use "reasonable force to maintain behaviour". This would be a breach of the human rights of children and young people in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/educational-excellence-everywhere

attributes.action: Consider a vote of no confidence in Nicky Morgan, Education Secretary
attributes.background: Nicky Morgan has recently introduced plans for every school in England to become an academy. State schools are regulated by parents and local authorities, wheras academies set their own curriculum, staff conditions and are run by a private sponsor.

attributes.action: Maintain the current policy that the Royal Air Force has on tattoos.
attributes.background: A petition has been raised to have the current policy looked at, with a view to allowing tattoos that are visible in No1 uniform. Many people strongly disagree with this, but haven't had the chance to show the government their response to the original petition. This will provide that opportunity.
attributes.additional_details: If only one side of the opinion is presented to the government, this will be biased. By having both petitions, it will provide a more realistic reflection of peoples' feelings on this matter.

attributes.action: Move the clock change day to a Thursday.
attributes.background: Move the clock change day to a Thursday so people can still have a lie in and enjoy their weekend as nobody is really bothered about losing an hours sleep before a Friday.

attributes.action: Allow uk citizens to view their progress of their tax rebate online
attributes.background: The amount of times my tax code has been changed incorrectly I've rang up to sort it out and later on rang again to check and there was no record of my previous call. In one occasion they debited my pay total in 2 months 800pound i would like it easier to some how log online to view the progress
attributes.additional_details: To be able to log online and check the status of a tax rebate  or if any money is due or owed I'm sure many other people feel the same way as to phone usually takes a minimum of 30 minutes on hold to get through. Once a women told me they didn't owe me anything I was debating it for 20 minutes and then she said oh yh I was looking at the wrong box. What would of happened if I said ok ??

attributes.action: Create Priority (BLUE) Routes for Disabled People, similar to Cycle Routes
attributes.background:
I have been a Mobility Scooter and driver for a number of years, however I now suffer from balance problems and have had my license withdrawn, so am even more reliant on my scooter.

I have found that using it is painful, tiring, dangerous, stressful and restricts my independence.
attributes.additional_details:
Not only are pavements bumpy, they have excessive cambers, even worse when crossing driveway accesses, and then there are the dropped kerbs at crossings. 
These have excessive slopes and cambers, tipping people toward the road and heavy traffic.
I was totally ignored by drivers several times, sworn and hooted at by others, particularly at blind corners.
Blue routes should be level, crossings safe perhaps controlled, warnings to drivers etc
We have cycle and red routes, lets have Blue Routes !!

attributes.action: Scrap the proposed Sugar Tax levy
attributes.background: This newly proposed Sugar Tax levy on the drinks giants is nothing more than, yet another in-direct taxation on the lower paid working class public.
attributes.additional_details:
If the government wishes to raise additional funds for the NHS, due to obese people putting additional pressure on the service, then the government should also place additional taxation on all the fitness fanatics, of whom cost the NHS millions each year in joint replacements, muscle and ligament rebuilds.

Other countries have tried to implement the same levy and have proved that it had little to no effect on the rates of obesity. 

Let’s get this crazy tax levy scrapped before it’s started.

attributes.action: Scrap emission based VED on private vehicles as it takes no account of miles pa
attributes.background:
Emission based VED takes no account of mileage.
A high VED vehicle paying £505 pa may only do 3000 miles pa and another vehicle paying £120 pa 20,000 miles pa
Have a basic VED for all  private vehicles incl electric and the rest  funded by tax on fuel for a pro rata rate of road usage

attributes.action: Petition for Flower Of Scotland to be the national anthem of Scotland.
attributes.background:
"There is no official national anthem of Scotland."

The Flower of Scotland should be the national anthem of Scotland, representing this nation.

attributes.action: Limit the time MP's can talk during a debate to stop the practice Fillabustering
attributes.background: The practice of "fillabustering" is an unfair practice used by opposition members to waste time during a Private Members Bill debate and therefore delay or entirely prevent a vote on the proposal.  We demand that time for any one member to talk during a debate on a bill is limited.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-18784131

attributes.action: Ex Pats should not be allowed to vote in the upcoming EU Referendum
attributes.background: Ex pats that have lived outside the UK for over 15 years should not be given a vote in the upcoming referendum. They have decided to live outside the UK and should not have a say in this important vote that affects those that live in the United Kingdom.
attributes.additional_details: With Ex Pats creating a future court case, the government is urged to not allow a vote from those living outside the UK for over 15 years. Such votes are likely to be biased and not a true reflection on those who reside in the United Kingdom.

attributes.action: Remove loophole allowing under aged girl married to an adult to live or be in UK
attributes.background: A current loophole in UK law allows young girls who married an aged man to circulate free in UK when married outside the UK. Sign this petition to remove this loophole and protect children by making this type of marriage completely illegal in UK.

attributes.action: Ban Barack Obama from UK for  remarks about the UK handling of  Libyan conflict.
attributes.background: Recent reports where American President Barack Obama has made derogatory remarks of the British and French governments involvement and poor performance in relation to the Libyan conflict.

attributes.action: Block Recep Tayyip Erdogan from coming to UK
attributes.background: His double standards on terrorism (by allowing the wounded terrorists in his country), deporting of Kurds (who are 100% against ISIS) and setting the ME very unstable are his violations of International Law. He must not be allowed to speak in UK!

attributes.action: Make government create a Bank of England national high street bank.
attributes.background:
I think the public should have an option to borrow/have mortgage from a private bank or to borrow from a national bank run and owned by government.         
I'd rather borrow from my own country's national bank and pay back with interest, instead of borrowing from foreign owned private banks.
attributes.additional_details:
I think the British public have a right to borrow/have mortgage from government. The Bank of England should have a branch in every high street. 
A national bank created just for small buissness/mortgage borrowing and basic current accounts.
Private banks profit billions pay their Chiefs millions and get bailed out by the public when they get it all wrong.
A nationally owned bank I think would help keep private banks in order.

attributes.action: Start to plan real strategy to deal with Donald Trump as President.
attributes.background: The USA could well be run by Donald Trump in 2017, he, his policies and his supporters are the biggest threat to democracy & world security in the 21st century. We must start planning for this possible outcome and distance ourselves from the United States of America.
attributes.additional_details:
Should Trump become President we should...

Stop buying US:
Weapons;
Goods;
Services; &
Oil (crude)

Remove:
US ran military bases in the UK and vote to remove them across the EU; &
Agreements to use UK airspace / airfields for US military (airforce, army, navy, et al)

Veto:
All US led UN war resolutions; &
All UN tabled resolutions that could result in an outbreak of war or invasion by the US or UN.

attributes.action: Upgrade the A303 now and ask for tenders by the end of this financial year.
attributes.background: A feasibility study to include a twenty four mile detour to include a Salisbury by-pass would not only delay the work, it would also cost more than a tunnel. I have written to the PM and local MPs regarding the A303 but have received negative responses.
attributes.additional_details: In the early 1950s some of the "Stones" we're straightened and had concrete support added, some of the works gang are still alive and photographs of the work are in Andover museum. I think that *EH want to hide the Stones from the A303, giving the traffic vibrations as cause of further damage to the site. Just how much vibration would be generated by excavating a tunnel? I maintained the A303 past the site for ten years and have sent a viable considerably cheaper route!

attributes.action: Want equal shares in profits in houses if a couple divorce with children
attributes.background: I recently went through a divorce and when when me and my ex wife separated it was me who left the house as my children x2 needed a home, so therefore it was better for me to leave. Once we got to court the judge awarded a 70/30 split in the house profits in favour of my ex wife. It seems unfair.
attributes.additional_details: I really think this law needs changing as my question is - What is that other 20% actually gaining for my children? Who is the main benefactor in this? Is it the children, or is it the adults? On a house with profit with or without kids should be 50/50 split. That way then both adults can create homes, instead of the man struggling.

attributes.action: Fine people who misuse A and E departments.
attributes.background: A and E departments are being misused.  This is causing backlogs and ambulance queues. Staff should be allowed to refuse to treat anything but accidents or emergencies.
attributes.additional_details: Last week my mother in law waited over 2 hours in an ambulance queue before she was able to be admitted.  While talking to a receptionist on the phone I overheard a patient saying they had come to A and E because they'd had a sore throat for 2 days.  This should be stopped!  A and E stands for accident and emergency the clue is in the title!  They are not doctors surgeries or pharmacies!

attributes.action: Minimum text size for "Excessive consumption may cause a laxative effect" etc.
attributes.background: Important information is often easy to overlook and can cause severe distress and discomfort.  Many sugar-free sweets, for example, are ... "incompatible" ... with a long train journey potentially without toilets.

attributes.action: Ban utility companies from charging existing customers more than new customers.
attributes.background: Ever had your internet/gas/electricity/insurance renewal quote come back much higher than you were paying? Wasted time phoning up just to get nowhere? Looked online to see much cheaper offers exist and spent ages switching just to have it all happen again next year? Ban this waste of time and money!
attributes.additional_details:
There is no reason why people should be charged a higher price just because they are an existing customer.
Utility companies offer cheap rates to attract new customers but they rip-off existing customers by pushing up the price each year; knowing many people won't bother switching.
Force companies to automatically roll-out the best offer available to all customers with a given profile and penalise if not done.
This wouldn't affect loyalty discounts for existing customers or no-claims bonuses.

attributes.action: Open up Transgender bathrooms
attributes.background: I would like for you to open up Transgender toilets around the UK so that people like me can go to the bathroom in public without having to feel awkward about who we are. It should be for both male and female trans people to use.
attributes.additional_details:
As a personal story, I always feel awkward going to use the female bathrooms in public places because it's uncomfortable feeling as if I'm not supposed to be there. And I know others will feel that way too. 
If we opened up the bathrooms, there would be less nervous people going into the bathrooms that they are not feeling assigned to.

attributes.action: Require online Parliamentary petitions to count any votes against a proposal
attributes.background: Online Parliamentary petitions are created frequently.  At present, only those people who support a proposal can register their views.  Those who disagree with proposals should be able to register a negative vote which counts against the total requiring a Government response or Parliamentary debate.

attributes.action: Allow family members of British Citizens in war zones or camps entry to the UK.
attributes.background: British Citizens are living in camps like Calais & Dunkirk waiting for family members to be granted leave to enter. I'd hope that the government would protect my family in crisis. We do not leave a friend of a friend on the doorstep in the rain. Get families of british citizens out of the camps.
attributes.additional_details:
Further links to Guardian article on this issue: 
http://www.theguardian.com/world/2016/jan/31/migrants-dunkirk-british-citizens-france-tent-city-iraqi-kurds-uk-passports

attributes.action: Stop current MPs being either be a director or shareholder of a company.
attributes.background:
Vested business interests influencing political decision making appears to be rife and uncontrolled.
MPs having a conflict of interests to be addressed and taken extremely seriously, with consequences of hefty fines and imprisonment.

attributes.action: Make all cyclists and horse riders wear hi-vis clothing whilst on the roads
attributes.background: Make it the law that all cyclists and horse riders should wear hi-vis clothing whilst riding on the roads. A lot of cyclists and horse riders on the roads don't get seen until the last minute due to not wearing suitable clothing, especially during dusk and dawn.
attributes.additional_details: Having appropriate high visibility clothing would make it safer if for them and car drivers, especially if for whatever reason they ride at night without lights on.

attributes.action: Help people with UK pensions move their money to their home before they retire.
attributes.background: HMRC has delisted thousands of overseas schemes that could previously accept pension transfers from Britain. This is due to the Qualifying Recognised Overseas Pension Scheme. Which has recently been introduced. Many people started pensions in the UK knowing they would not be retiring in the UK.

attributes.action: Make the DBS filtering system fairer for people with more than 2 convictions.
attributes.background:
People that commit more than one petty offence have to declare this to some employers on application even though their offences may be petty or recorded decades ago.
With prisoners being released early and people getting a slapped wrist for serious offences today, historical offenders stand to lose
attributes.additional_details:
Since being made redundant, my friend has been unable to get another job because 35 years ago, he took a hub cap off a dumped car and on another occasion altered a road tax disk. Employers are unlikely to offer him a job because of it. In fact, a criminal with one serious offence that has lapsed can have his/her record filtered after a period of time.
I think petty recorded crimes recorded over decades ago should be filtered also. The current system is ridiculous and discriminatory.

attributes.action: Grant a referendum on UK nuclear deterrent, - too important for mere Politicians
attributes.background: A UK referendum should dictate whether independent nuclear deterrent is maintained or upgraded, - too vital an issue for mere Politicians, - if a referendum on the less important EU matter is appropriate, so should survival of Humankind. Denial means MPs decide to protect UK population from itself?

attributes.action: Allow 'Calais migrants' to enter the UK for the Queen's 90th birthday.
attributes.background: We are being encouraged to have street/village tea parties to celebrate the Queen's birthday. I think something more tangible,useful and humanitarian such as allowing Calais migrants entry to the UK would be a more fitting tribute.

attributes.action: Change the start date of BST to the last Sunday in February ..
attributes.background: BST starts far too late and should start a month earlier. It understandable that we need winter savings but there in sufficient morning light at the beginning of March and summer time should start earlier.

attributes.action: Government must disclose all details regarding googles tax arrangement
attributes.background: Google PLC are known as "The largest company in the world". Due to vast profits partially generated in the UK. (10% - Ref 1).  It is said that those with the broadest shoulders should be bearing the strain but the google tax deal reveals how hollow those words are.  The deal should be exposed!
attributes.additional_details: Ref 1. http://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1288776/000128877615000023/goog10-qq12015.htm - This would make 10% of profits from the UK equal to 5.2 BILLION in profits in 2015.  Attracting a tax liability of 1.04 BILLION for 2015 alone.  However the deal of £130 MILLION for 10 years is just another in a long line of large corporations avoiding their responsibilities.

attributes.action: Stop using Private finance initiatives for investment into public services
attributes.background: Private finance initiatives are inherently poor value for money schemes which use private investment to fund public work but in the long run cost government and allow private firms to profit from tax payer money. Therefore government should move from this short termism culture to reduce the deficit.

attributes.action: Radically overhaul the current frustrating and upsetting 111 phone system.
attributes.background: Employ adequately trained medically qualified call operators that are able to assess, understand and provide vulnerable and ill callers seeking medical advice with an appropriate level of service and advice of where to obtain the relevant care they require.

attributes.action: Provide funding for students' public transport costs
attributes.background: There are financially deprived students who are discouraged from attending University. A number of students use public transport as a means of getting to University. There are some students who board trains with invalid tickets due to little or no money. Public transport is a heavy financial strain.

attributes.action: Regulate imports of clothing from unethical sources.
attributes.background: Thousands of workers in countries such as India are being exploited and being payed close to nothing for their hard work. Their work places are unsafe as shown by the Rana Plaza collapse. We want our government to help stop this and make sure garments coming in to our country are properly sourced.
attributes.additional_details: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2013_Savar_building_collapse

attributes.action: Raise the speed limit in the outside lane of a motorway for easier overtaking.
attributes.background: The 70 mile per hour speed limit was introduced back in 1965 and since that time cars have become much safer due to shorter stopping distances and more rigorous safety standards for car manufacturers. Roads have not advanced at the same pace however and are stuck using an outdated speed limit.
attributes.additional_details:
Cars today are also fitted with advanced technologies such as ABS and automatic braking. They have become safer but the roads have not grown to accommodate them. 
It should not be assumed that all vehicles have the same stopping distance and often cars that can achieve higher speeds have better stopping distances. For example a McLaren P1 (sporty car but still a good example) can stop in 30.2 metres while the Highway Code states it should take 102 metres to stop from the same speed.

attributes.action: lift the motorcycle restriction law.
attributes.background: lift the motorcycle restriction law and allow learners and full license holders with a valid cbt to drive any size bike at any age and not have the motorcycle restricted to a certain speed.
